name.en: Chair of Security and Theoretical Computer Science

structural_unit_name.en: Chair of Security and Theoretical Computer Science

description.en: The course covers the following topics: Fast Fourier Transform, fast multiplication of the polynomials using FFT, efficient algorithm for finding maximun flow in the network, max-flow in 0-1 network, finding min-cost maximum flow, linear programming, primal and dual problems, approximation algorithms for various combinatorial problems (set cover, travelling salesman problem, minimum feedback set problem), using linear-programming in approximation algorithms, primal-dual approach.
description.et: Kursuses käsitletakse järgmisi teemasid: kiire Fourier teisendus (FFT), polünoomide kiire korrutamine kasutades FFT, efektiivne algoritm maksimaalse voo arvutamiseks võrgus, maksimaalne voog 0-1 võrgus,   lineaarne planeerimine, otsene ja duaalne ülesanne, ligikaudsed algoritmid kombinatoorika mitmesuguste ülesannete (hulga katmine, rändkaupmehe ülesanne,...) jaoks kasutades lineaarset programmeerimist ligikaudsetes algoritmides ning otse-duaalne lähenemist.

objectives.en: Understand the variety of techniques for development and analysis of algorithms for various fundamental problems in computer science.
objectives.et: Saada aru arvutiteaduse põhiülesannete lahendamisel kasutatavate algoritmide arendamise ja analüüsimise erinevatest tehnikatest.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing this course, the student will be able:
* to use various algorithmic techniques and concepts, such as fast Fourier transform, maximum flow in the networks, linear-programming, approximation algorithm techniques
learning_outcomes.et: * kasutama erinevaid algoritme, nt Fourier teisendus, maksimaalne voog võrkudes, lineaarne planeerimine, ligikaudsed algoritmid

learning_outcomes.en: * to be able to analyze the time complexity of the algorithms, to prove their correctness, and to show approximation factor (for approximation algorithms)
learning_outcomes.et: * analüüsima algoritmide ajalist keerukust, tõestama nende korrektsust ja leidma ligikaudsuse hinnagut

learning_outcomes.en: * to read and understand medium-difficulty mathematical and computer science texts in the area;
learning_outcomes.et: * aru saama keskmise raskusega matemaatilisest ja arvutiteaduse alasest tekstidest

learning_outcomes.en: *	to develop appropriate algorithms for a variety of applied problems, to analyze their performance and prove their correctness
learning_outcomes.et: * välja töötama sobivaid algoritme mitmesuguste rakendusülesannete jaoks, analüüsima nende jõudlust ja tõestama nende korrektsust

description.et:
Homeworks: 30% of the final grade

grade_preconditions.et: Submission of homeworks, midterm and final exam

description.et: Properties of trees. Proof of correctness of Prim's algorithm.
O()-notation. Comparison of complexity functions. Trees.
Min-cut max-flow theorem. Finding a maximum matching in a bipartite graph.
Correctness of Dinitz algorithm. Finding vertex-disjoint path cover.
Vertex cover in a bipartite graph. Flow networks with lower and upper limits.
Divide an conquer: merge sort, Karatsuba algorithm, Strassen algorithm
Fast Fourier Transform: examples.
Schwartz-Zippel lemma and polynomial identity testing. Karger's algorithm.
Linear programming: primal and dual problems, weak and strong duality theorems.
Simplex method using tableau format.
Set Cover problem. Traveling Salesman problem.
PTAS and FPTAS. Knapsack problem.
Using LP in approximation algorithms. Dual fitting based proof for the set cover problem. Rounding algorithm for the set cover.
Flow in networks
Introduction into graph theory. Trees.
Prim and Kruskal algorithm.
Dinitz algorithm.
Dinitz algorithm in 0-1 networks
Flow networks with lower and upper limits (cont.) Multiplication of polynomials
Fast Fourier Transform
Probabilistic algorithms. Rabin-Miller algorithm for primality testing
Karger's algorithm (cont.) Linear programming problems
Simplex algorithm
Simplex algorithm: degeneracy example. Approximation algorithms. Vertex Cover problem
Travelling Salesman Problem in directed graphs
PTAS for the bin packing problem
Minimum spanning trees.
